MVCF.ModDef.label: Star Wars Droids
MVCF.ModDef.description: Adding droid ranged attacks for Star Wars droids

ThingDef.label: 3PO Protocol Droid
ThingDef.description: The 3PO protocol droid is a model of protocol droid produced by Cybot Galactica. They are equipped with a TranLang III communication module, and as a result are fluent in over 6 million forms of communication.

ThingDef.label: 3PX Protocol Droid
ThingDef.description: The 3PX protocol droid is a model of protocol droid produced by Cybot Galactica. The 3PX line is marketed exclusively in the Outer Rim Territories, and due to the diversity of that region, have a less Human design than the mainline 3PO units.

ThingDef.label: RA-7 Protocol Droid
ThingDef.description: The RA-7 protocol droid is a model of protocol droid manufactured by Arakyd Industries. Their heads resemble those of a insectoid species.

ThingDef.label: RQ Protocol Droid
ThingDef.description: The RQ protocol droid is a model of protocol droid manufactured by Lothal Logistics Limited. They often lack the expensive metallic plating on other protocol droids, which means they don't require costly cosmetic upgrades, making them ideal for use in governments, military, and private ownership.

AbilityDef.label: change to combat mode
AbilityDef.description: Change to combat mode (build-in wrist blaster appears).

AbilityDef.label: change to protocol mode
AbilityDef.description: Change to protocol mode (droid can do basic work and hauling).

ThingDef.label: E-XD Infiltrator Droid
ThingDef.description: The E-XD infiltrator droid is a model of recon droid used by the Galactic Empire. E-XD infiltrator droids resemble RQ protocol droids but are in fact specialized recon droids that are fitted with various integrated weapons including built-in blasters. Explodes when it dies.

ThingDef.label: TC Protocol Droid
ThingDef.description: The TC protocol droid is a model of protocol droid produced by Cybot Galactica. It has the same overall appearance and size as the popular 3PO droids, but presents a few differences. Notably, the manufacturer advertises TC units as being cooler and more unflappable than their 3PO cousins.

ThingDef.label: DG-1B Catering Droid
ThingDef.description: The DG-1B catering droid is a model of service droid manufactured by Industrial Automaton, programmed to cater during social events. The droids have blue sensors and wear a white apron.

ThingDef.label: DLC-13 Mining Droid
ThingDef.description: The DLC-13 mining droid is a mining droid used to extract valuable ores from inhospitable environments. The droids are made from heat-resistant carbonite and are fitted with large, underslung collection buckets to transport minerals back to harvesting centers.

ThingDef.label: DUM Pit Droid
ThingDef.description: A DUM pit droid is a droid manufactured by Serv-O-Droid, Inc. and used in labor, repair and light construction. They are also associated with repairing podracers at podracing events.

ThingDef.label: D-Wing Air Support Droid
ThingDef.description: The D-wing air support droid is an aerial battle droid and a variant of the B-series droid line. The droids have wings that they use to pursue enemies to areas where normal battle droids could not. They are developed by the Techno Union and used by the Confederacy of Independent Systems during the Clone Wars.

ThingDef.label: D-Wing Air Support Droid
ThingDef.description: The D-wing air support droid is an aerial battle droid and a variant of the B-series droid line. The droids have wings that they use to pursue enemies to areas where normal battle droids could not. They are developed by the Techno Union and used by the Confederacy of Independent Systems during the Clone Wars.

ThingDef.label: IT-O Interrogator Droid
ThingDef.description: The IT-O interrogator droid is an interrogation droid designed by the Imperial Security Bureau and employed by the Galactic Empire. It is a hovering droid with various attachments, deliberately frightening in appearance, used in torture. The droid is generally successful in getting information from prisoners using elaborate and scientific torture methods.

HediffDef.label: tortured
HediffDef.description: Pain caused by an IT-O interrogator droid. If exposure to the droid continues, it could lead to a mental break.

ThingDef.label: KX Security Droid
ThingDef.description: The KX security droid is a model of security droid manufactured by Arakyd Industries that was in service to the Galactic Empire during the Galactic Civil War. The droids are designed with exaggerated human proportions but with the mobility of a human athlete.

ThingDef.label: 2-1B Medical Droid
ThingDef.description: The 2-1B medical droid is a model of medical droid manufactured by Industrial Automaton that was common throughout the galaxy during the Clone Wars and Galactic Civil War. All 2-1B droids are equipped with encyclopedic memory banks to ensure that the droids gave the best course of medical treatment in any given medical situation.

ThingDef.label: Viper Probe Droid
ThingDef.description: The Viper probe droid is a model of probe droid manufactured by Arakyd Industries that is used by the Galactic Empire for deep space exploration and reconnaissance.

ThingDef.label: Viper Probe Droid
ThingDef.description: The Viper probe droid is a model of probe droid manufactured by Arakyd Industries that is used by the Galactic Empire for deep space exploration and reconnaissance.

ThingDef.label: DT Sentry Droid
ThingDef.description: The DT sentry droid is a line of sentry droids manufactured by Baktoid Combat Automata and utilized by the Galactic Empire. Imperial sentry droids, equipped with a built-in E-11 medium blaster rifle, are used as guards and combat training units.

ThingDef.label: WA-7 Waitress Droid
ThingDef.description: The WA-7 waitress droid is a service droid produced by GoCorp and Utilitech propelled by an effective unipod wheel supported by gyro-balance circuitry. The unipod's drive impellers generates enough power for quick bursts of speed ideal for use within confined spaces such as the floor of a dining establishment.

ThingDef.label: R2 Astromech Droid
ThingDef.description: The R2 astromech droid is a model of astromech droid produced by Industrial Automaton, boasting a level of success that was never equaled in Industrial Automaton's long history. A combination of excellent design and high-quality marketing makes this droid one of the most sought after droids in history.

ThingDef.label: R3 Astromech Droid
ThingDef.description: The R3 astromech droid is a model of astromech droid produced by Industrial Automaton. Thanks to their Intellex V processors, R3 astromechs have faster processing abilities than the more common R2 units. The transparency gives the droid's internal sensor package greater range.

ThingDef.label: R4 Agromech Droid
ThingDef.description: The R4 agromech droid is a model of astromech droid produced by Industrial Automaton. It is designed for life outside the pristine hangar bay. It is simpler, tougher, and cheaper than previous models.

ThingDef.label: R5 Astromech Droid
ThingDef.description: The R5 astromech droid is a model of astromech droid produced by Industrial Automaton. Cut-price versions of superior R2 units, they are low cost, but prone to malfunctions, defects, and bad attitudes.

ThingDef.label: R6 Astromech Droid
ThingDef.description: The R6 astromech droid is a model of astromech droid produced by Industrial Automaton. It is an attempt at repairing their own reputation after the tremendous failure that was their R5 series. The designers of the R6 took their time in working out every problem and glitch that plagued the previous model.

ThingDef.label: C1 Astromech Droid
ThingDef.description: The C1 astromech droid is a model of astromech droid produced by Industrial Automaton. All C1 droids have three sensors and an antenna on the dome.

ThingDef.label: BB Astromech Droid
ThingDef.description: The BB astromech droid is a model of astromech droid produced by Industrial Automaton, featuring a spherical body that allowes the droid to roll in any direction, with a head usually atop the body but not meant to be permanently physically attached to it.

ThingDef.label: MSE-6 Repair Droid
ThingDef.description: The MSE-6 repair droid, sometimes referred to as the mouse droid, was a small, box-shaped, wheeled general purpose droid often used for delivery and maintenance purposes.

ThingDef.label: GNK Power Droid
ThingDef.description: The GNK power droid is a well-known type of power droid manufactured by Industrial Automaton as a knockoff of the successful EG power droid. They are often referred to as gonk droids in imitation of their honking sound. Due to a lack of the original fusion generators it needs a continuous supply of chemfuel or the generator stops working. They produce 1W per second and consume 4.5 chemfuel per day. Explodes when it dies.

ThingDef.label: EG Power Droid
ThingDef.description: The EG power droid was a model of power droid manufactured by Veril Line Systems. It emitts low honking sounds, which earns it the nickname of gonk droid. Due to a lack of the original fusion generators it needs a continuous supply of chemfuel or the generator stops working. They produce 1W per second and consume 4.5 chemfuel per day. Explodes when it dies.
